title: Magnetic flux - tetrahedron in constant B-field

content.question: A four-faced pyramid whose faces are comprised of equilateral triangles is at rest on a horizontal table. The pyramid is composed of a material that does not interact with magnetic fields. A uniform magnetic field of constant magnitude <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi></math> is directed vertically downward throughout the entire region shown. If the area of each face of the pyramid is <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi></math>, what is the net magnetic flux passing through the top three surfaces of the pyramid that are not in contact with the table?

choices.label: <math alttext="3 B A times the sine of 60 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mi>B</mi><mi>A</mi><mi>sin</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>60</mn><mo>°</mo><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>
